concept.title: Example: DITA map with a simple relationship table
concept.shortdesc: This example illustrates how to interpret a basic three-column relationship table used to maintain links between concept, task, and reference material.

conbody.p: The following example contains the markup for a simple relationship table:
conbody.codeblock: <map> <!-- ... --> <reltable> <relheader> <relcolspec type="concept"/> <relcolspec type="task"/> <relcolspec type="reference"/> </relheader> <relrow> <relcell> <topicref href="A.dita"/> </relcell> <relcell> <topicref href="B.dita"/> </relcell> <relcell> <topicref href="C1.dita"/> <topicref href="C2.dita"/> </relcell> </relrow> </reltable> </map>
conbody.p:
A DITA-aware tool might represent the relationship table graphically:
type="concept" type="task" type="reference"
A B
C1 C2
When the output is generated, the topics contain the following linkage:

dlentry.dd: Links to B, C1, and C2
Links to A, C1, and C2
